item.title: Windows Kernel Shellcode : TokenStealer
item.description: A typical Reverse/Bind shellcode will not work when it comes to Windows Kernel Exploitation, most of the time people often use (Nulling out ACLs, Enabling privileges or Replacing process token).

item.title: About
item.description: $ whoami My name is Oussama Amri, usually going by the alias “amriunix”. More than ten years of self made experience in Information Security of various environments. Performed dozens of web application pentesting/hardening tasks (Black/White box), Source code auditing/hardening, network penetration testing, 802.11 penetration testing, binary exploitation and Familiar with multiple scripting languages along with arsenal of penetration testing tools. $ contact If you would like to contact me, feel free to do so at any of the usual places:
